meanings.definition: An educational talk given to a group of people, typically in a formal setting.
meanings.sent1: During the lecture, the teacher explained the math problem step by step.
meanings.sent2: The students attended the lecture on history in the school auditorium.
meanings.sent3: The lecture about dinosaurs was so interesting that even the sleepy students perked up.
meanings.sent4: Her lecture on environmental conservation planted seeds of awareness in the young minds.
meanings.sent5: The professor's lecture on space exploration was out of this world!

meanings.definition: To give a talk or speech to someone in order to instruct or criticize them.
meanings.sent1: She will lecture the team on the importance of teamwork during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The coach decided to lecture the players on the importance of discipline in sports.
meanings.sent3: After the messy room incident, Mom decided to lecture her kids on cleanliness.
meanings.sent4: The boss continued to lecture the employees on the company's core values.
meanings.sent5: The teacher lectured the students on the consequences of not completing their homework.
